page.title: 20Blacksmiths shop Llangybi
page.content: The Smithy is opposite the village green.It is a familly buisiness employing four people.Two men are employed on farriery and shoe an average of four hourses a day.The cost of a set of shoes is Â£10_Â£12 depending on size.Most of the trade comes from hunting horses and childrens ponies as Llangybi as its own hunt and several local people own horses.Other customers come from within a ten mile radius.Two other men undertake general repairs which range from baby's pushchairs to combine harvesters. Ornamental work includes fire places, dog baskets,pokers and screens. Recently a crown was made for the restored town clock in nearby Usk.
